text: 14.90 Development should create streets and spaces with a degree of enclosure by assisting in defining the edges of the public realm, through continuous building lines and active frontages. Development should avoid creating concealment points and external lighting should be an integral component in ensuring safety and security within the public realm in line with the principles of secured by design. To reduce street Tower Hamlets Local Plan 183 PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES clutter, street lighting should be discreetly integrated into the design of buildings, where this is possible and does not adversely affect levels of light pollution for residents. 14.91 Balconies overhanging the public footway/ highway or onto neighbouring properties and buildings and spaces of civic importance have the potential to harm the safety and amenity of local occupiers, residents, and the public highway as well as cause overlooking, especially at the ground floor level.
